block.p: Alexandra Leigh Kauffman, a daughter of Sandra and Charles F. Kauffman of Chevy Chase, Md., is to be married today to Michael Evan Horowitz, the son of Anne J. Horowitz of Suffern, N.Y., and the late Fred Horowitz. Dr. Ronald B. Sobel, the senior rabbi at Congregation Emanu-El in New York, is to officiate at Raspberry Plain, a historic house in Leesburg, Va.

The bride, 34, is a field producer in Washington for CNN, covering economics and personal finance. She graduated magna cum laude from Brown University and received a master's degree in communication from the University of Michigan. Her parents operate Kauffman International, a mail-order and Internet saddlery in Chevy Chase. Mr. Kauffman owned H. Kauffman & Sons Saddlery, a former New York company that was founded in 1875 by the bride's great-great-grandfather Hermann Kauffman.

The bridegroom, 37, is the chief of staff to James K. Robinson, the assistant attorney general for the Justice Department's criminal division in Washington. Mr. Horowitz graduated summa cum laude from Brandeis University and received a law degree magna cum laude from Harvard. His mother, now retired, owned Anne-Tique-Tock, an antiques store in Nyack, N.Y. His father owned Paul Alfred Inc., a former maker of private-label women's clothing in New York.
